parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

post.summary: Link a boltcard to a pull payment
post.description: Linking a boltcard to a pull payment will allow you to pay via NFC with it, the money will be sent from the pull payment. The boltcard keys are generated using [Deterministic Boltcard Key Generation](https://github.com/boltcard/boltcard/blob/main/docs/DETERMINISTIC.md).

onExisting.description:
What to do if the boltcard is already linked.
 * `KeepVersion` will return the keys (K0-K4) that are already registered.
 * `UpdateVersion` will increment the version of the key, and thus return different keys (K0-K4). (See [Deterministic Boltcard Key Generation](https://github.com/boltcard/boltcard/blob/main/docs/DETERMINISTIC.md))

200.description: The boltcard has been linked to the pull payment.

LNURLW.description: The lnurl withdraw of the server

version.description: The version of the registration (See [Deterministic Boltcard Key Generation](https://github.com/boltcard/boltcard/blob/main/docs/DETERMINISTIC.md))

K0.description: The public key K0 of the boltcard

K1.description: The public key K1 of the boltcard

K2.description: The public key K2 of the boltcard

K3.description: The public key K3 of the boltcard

K4.description: The public key K4 of the boltcard

404.description: The pull payment has not been found. Wellknown error code is: `pullpayment-not-found`

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description: Whether this should list archived pull payments

get.description: Get the pull payments of a store

403.description: If you are authenticated but forbidden to get the data

post.description: A pull payment allows its receiver to ask for payouts up to `amount` of `currency` every `period`.

name.description: The name of the pull payment

description.description: The description of the pull payment

amount.description: The amount in `currency` of this pull payment as a decimal string

BOLT11Expiration.description: If lightning is activated, do not accept BOLT11 invoices with expiration less than … days

autoApproveClaims.description: Any payouts created for this pull payment will skip the approval phase upon creation

startsAt.description: When this pull payment is effective. Already started if null or unspecified.

expiresAt.description: When this pull payment expires. Never expires if null or unspecified.

payoutMethods.description: The list of supported payout methods supported by this pull payment. Available options can be queried from the `StorePaymentMethods_GetStorePaymentMethods` endpoint. If `null`, all available payout methods will be supported.

parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

delete.description: Archive this pull payment (Will cancel all payouts awaiting for payment)

200.description: The pull payment has been archived

404.description: The pull payment has not been found, or does not belong to this store

parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

parameters.name: includeCancelled
parameters.description: Whether this should list cancelled payouts

200.description: The payouts of the pull payment
A new payout has been created

parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

parameters.name: payoutId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment payout

200.description: A specific payout of a pull payment

parameters.name: pullPaymentId
parameters.description: The ID of the pull payment

400.description: Pull payment found but does not support LNURL

200.description: A new payout has been created

parameters.name: includeCancelled
parameters.description: Whether this should list cancelled payouts

200.description: A specific payout of a store

revision.description: The revision number of the payout being modified

rateRule.description: The rate rule to calculate the rate of the payout. This can also be a fixed decimal. (if null or unspecified, will use the same rate setting as the store's settings)

200.description: The payout has been approved, transitioning to `AwaitingPayment` state.
The payout has been marked paid, transitioning to `Completed` state.

post.description: Mark a payout with a state

200.description: The payout has been set to the specified state

destination.description: The destination of the payout (can be an address or a BIP21 url)

amount.description: The amount of the payout in the currency of the pull payment (eg. USD).

pullPaymentId.description: The pull payment to create this for. Optional.

approved.description: Whether to approve this payout automatically upon creation

metadata.description: Additional metadata to store with the payout

PayoutPaymentProof.description: Additional information around how the payout is being or has been paid out. The mentioned properties are all optional (except `proofType`) and you can introduce any json format you wish.

proofType.description: The type of payment proof it is.

link.description: A link to the proof of payout payment.

id.description: A unique identifier to the proof of payout payment.

revision.description: The revision number of the payout. This revision number is incremented when the payout amount or destination is modified before the approval.

pullPaymentId.description: The id of the pull payment this payout belongs to

date.description: The creation date of the payout as a unix timestamp

destination.description: The destination of the payout (can be an address or a BIP21 url)

originalCurrency.description: The currency before being converted into the payout's currency

originalAmount.description: The amount in originalCurrency before being converted into the payout's currency

payoutCurrency.description: The currency of the payout after conversion.

payoutAmount.description: The amount in payoutCurrency after conversion. (This property is set after the payout has been Approved)

metadata.description: Additional information around the payout that can be supplied. The mentioned properties are all optional and you can introduce any json format you wish.

source.description: The source of the payout creation. Shown on the payout list page.

sourceLink.description: A link to the source of the payout creation. Shown on the payout list page.

name.description: Name given to pull payment when it was created

description.description: Description given to pull payment when it was created

currency.description: The currency of the pull payment's amount

amount.description: The amount in the currency of this pull payment as a decimal string

BOLT11Expiration.description: If lightning is activated, do not accept BOLT11 invoices with expiration less than … days

autoApproveClaims.description: Any payouts created for this pull payment will skip the approval phase upon creation

archived.description: Whether this pull payment is archived

viewLink.description: The link to a page to claim payouts to this pull payment
